source.name: Chainlink Definition
source.instructions: Which of the following best describes Chainlink?

answers.answer: A blockchain platform for creating smart contracts
A decentralized oracle network connecting smart contracts with real-world data and services
A consensus mechanism for validating blockchain transactions

source.guidance: Chainlink is best described as a decentralized oracle network that connects smart contracts with real-world data and services. It is not a blockchain platform itself, nor a cryptocurrency exchange or consensus mechanism. Chainlink's primary function is to provide reliable, tamper-proof inputs and outputs for complex smart contracts on any blockchain, enabling them to interact with external data sources, APIs, and traditional bank payment systems.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT define Chainlink and its primary function in the blockchain ecosystem
